snippet: The killing of a key witness in the deadliest election-related violence in Philippines history appeared to be an attempt to eliminate or intimidate those who could testify, a prosecutor said on Thursday.
abstract: Esmail Amil Enog, a key witness in the deadly 2009 election-related massacre in the Philippines, is tortured and murdered; he is the third witness to have been killed since the investigation into the violence began in 2010; death appears to be an attempt by the Ampatuan family, who have been accused of perpetrating the massacre, to eliminate or intimidate those who could testify against them.
lead_paragraph: The killing of a key witness in the deadliest election-related violence in Philippines history appeared to be an attempt to eliminate or intimidate those who could testify, a prosecutor said on Thursday.

headline.main: Third Witness to Massacre in Philippines Is Murdered
headline.print_headline: Third Witness To Massacre In Philippines Is Murdered
